p: In Italy, the estimated incidence of influenza in the 2017-2018 season was >8.5 million [ 8], which indicates greater severity than previous seasons. The epidemic period started earlier than usual, and the peak incidence (estimated at 14.73 per 1,000 inhabitants) was observed in the week 02/2018 [ 8]. Some 60% of all laboratory-confirmed influenza cases were caused by influenza B virus (IBV) [ 9].
